commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: One, two, three, four. Kasumi, you're falling behind.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: R-Right!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: One, two, three, four. One, two, three, four.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I-I'm getting a cramp in my leg...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: And that's a wrap! Take five, everyone. Make sure you stay hydrated.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: W-We finally get a break. Is it just me, or is practice way harder than usual today?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, it's pretty tough. Phew... I'm sure she's just fired up because the festival is starting to take shape. We need to pick up the pace and keep up with practice.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: W-Well, it might be tough for you, but not for me! What kind of top school idol would give up after a harder training regimen? I'll be fine after a break!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I never should have doubted you! You're such a beefcake, Kasumi!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Emma, I don't think there are many girls who would appreciate being called a beefcake...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hey, we might not be beefy, but we've got a lot more endurance now than we did before. And how do you think we got there? By raising the steaks, of course!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: But we have to keep that momentum going every single day. I'm gonna work even harder. Rina-chan Board says, "Powering up!"

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: That's the spirit. Putting in the effort is the first step toward realizing your goals.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: You think if we keep it up, we'll be more like Î¼'s or Aqours?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: C'mon, what are you talking about, Kanata? We're going to be on the same stage as them. We HAVE to be as good or better!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Everyone here has their own unique charm that can't be matched by anyone.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Our own unique charm... I see. You are absolutely right!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We've already got the charm, so all we've gotta do is build from there!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: You're so right, Kasumi! We'll never make our dreams come true unless we believe in ourselves!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: *Chuckle* You're so dependable, Shizuku!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: This isn't just for us. It's for our dreams! We have to work even harder!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Oh, speaking of dreams. I heard our new student council president, Shioriko Mifune, isn't doing so great with her council duties lately.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Ah, yeah. I heard that too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? Really?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Is she running into some problems or something?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Apparently, all those students who changed clubs or switched from being players to managers wound up changing their minds 'cause they wanted to chase their dreams instead.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Well, of course they did. The whole reason people join clubs is because they want to. I doubt most people would quit just because someone said they weren't any good at it.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Exactly. You can't give up on the things you love. I wouldn't listen to anyone saying I had to throw away my body pillow just 'cause it's all lumpy!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I'm not quite sure that is the best example, Kanata.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Anyway, I totally agree with you guys, but apparently, she's going around trying to convince everyone to switch back 'cause it's what's best for their future.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: And that's the cause of the backlash?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You got it. A friend of mine was like, I totally appreciate the input, but she's being super pushy about it.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: One of my classmates was sayin' she was kinda creeped out 'cause it felt like Mifune was watching them to make sure they were doing what she wanted.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: So basically, Mifune Inc. ain't lookin' so hot.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: That explains why she hasn't been showing up around here lately.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I thought she might have something to say to us again, but it seems she's in no position to do so right now...

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Mifune is trying her very best, though...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Huh? Wait, are you sympathizing with her, Setsuna?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: After all she did to us, how could you possibly find it in you to feel bad for her?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It's not sympathy. I just understand her all too well as her opponent during the election. Mifune has so much talent and passion. I want that to be recognized.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: She might be passionate, but she stole the presidency from you, Setsuna. Just because you work your hardest doesn't mean you're going to reap the rewards, you know.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I know that, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Are you worried about her?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Yes. I am concerned.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: You're so kind, Setsuna.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: That's not what it is... I just know what it's like to work hard and have nothing come of it.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I know I may be repeating myself, but I really do think that Mifune has the makings of an excellent student council president.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: It just goes to show how difficult being a student council president must be if Mifune of all people is struggling with it...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It's just proof that no matter how capable you might be, you can't control people's hearts!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I really do believe that Mifune has their best interests in mind when she offers people advice. She is not merely forcing her ideas upon them for no reason.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: While she may work in a completely different way to us, Mifune is trying to help others realize their dreams in her own way.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Maybe she's just trying to create the perfect environment to make that happen?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You might be right... At the very least, she was always thinking of others during the election, and that's what drove her actions.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's why she went out of her way to propose a special election and become student council president. And now, she's still doing her very best.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I want to support people who strive to do their best. I want their efforts to be recognized!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, I want to support Mifune too.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Now I kinda feel that way as well.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Me too.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: You're all so nice. Well, I suppose I also want people's hard work to be recognized. Otherwise, there's no point in having hopes or dreams.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I don't really like Shioriko Mifune...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: But it's the duty of a school idol to support anyone who does their best!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Maybe it'd be a good idea to have Mifune listen to the song that Riko's writing.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Is there anything we can do? I want to help Mifune out somehow.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I mean, sure, but I'm still having a hard time dealing with how she only treats us school idols poorly.
